title: Homemade Vanilla Almond Milk
directions: Place almonds in a bowl and enough cold water to cover the almonds by 1-2 inches. Cover and let stand at room temperature or in the fridge for at least 12 hours.
In a small bowl combine the dates and 1/2 cup boiling water. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.
Drain and rinse almonds with cold water. Transfer almonds to a blender. Add 3½ cups cold water, undrained dates, xanthan gum, and vanilla. Cover and blend on high speed for 1 to 2 minutes.
Strain mixture into a bowl using a nut milk bag.
Pour into a pitcher; cover and refrigerate up to 5 days. Almond meal is good for up to a week in the fridge, or freeze for later use.
To pasteurize the milk, sous vide at 145F for 30-45min
ingredients: ¼ to ½ teaspoon xanthan gum (optional)*
